What is the Verus testnet, and how can I access it?

The Verus testnet is a full-featured, intrinsically decentralized multi-chain blockchain platform that offers unlimited capabilities, including identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains. You can access the Verus testnet through the released versions of Verus Desktop and Verus CLI wallets, where it is represented as the VRSCTEST coin.

The new Verus testnet is a full-featured, intrinsically decentralized multi-chain blockchain platform with an unlimited number of identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains. It is accessible from the released versions of Verus Desktop and Verus CLI wallets, and it is the beginning of a new age in crypto. There are so many things you can do with Verus that you cannot with any other cryptocurrency platform, and you can try them all today.As Verus PBaaS offers completely new capabilities that go beyond today’s decentralized platforms in many fundamental ways, the worldwide Verus community put its energy into creation, rather than convincing everyone that its capabilities are possible. Members across the Verus worldwide community have worked hard to make this all possible, and we are more than excited that you can now experience it firsthand. If you have an interest in the future of crypto, you owe it to yourself to learn about Verus, an unlimited scale, decentralized future with truth and privacy for all.### The Verus testnet, available in the Verus Desktop or cli wallets as the VRSCTEST coin, has the following capabilities, which to our knowledge are unique in crypto today.### Self sovereign, revocable, recoverable identities (currently on mainnet) VerusID
- Enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable.
## Staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault)
- Enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked, but still allowing seamless staking of funds. When locked, a user specifies an unlock delay, typically long enough to notice when someone who might have compromised a user’s keys would have to unlock the ID before spending. What are some unique capabilities of the Verus testnet?

The Verus testnet offers several unique capabilities, including self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable identities (VerusID) and staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault). These features enable users to have full control over their identities and funds, while also providing an additional layer of security against theft.

How do VerusIDs work, and what benefits do they provide?

VerusIDs are self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable identities that enable permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses. This means that users have full control over their identities and can revoke or recover them as needed, providing a high level of security and flexibility.

What is Verus Vault, and how does it work?

Verus Vault is a feature that enables staking-capable time locking and theft prevention. It allows users to lock their identities, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked, but still allowing seamless staking of funds. When locked, a user specifies an unlock delay, which provides an additional layer of security against theft. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is through a specific process that ensures the security of the user's funds.
